statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: SOUTHERN CONF TR AT CHARLESTON SC

article.headline: Davidson 65, Elon University 58
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Ian Johnson had 23 points, including 15 from 3-point range, to pace Davidson to a 65-58 victory over Elon on Saturday and a spot in the championship game of the Southern Conference basketball tournament. The Wildcats meet Chattanooga, an earlier 78-75 winner over Appalachian State, for the tournament championship on Sunday with the winner advancing to the NCAA tournament. Davidson (19-10) trailed only once on Saturday, at 19-18 in the first quarter. But then Johnson hit a 3-pointer for a lead the Wildcats held the rest of the way. But it wasn't a walkover. Davidson, the tournament's third-seed, led 35-28 at the half and built the lead to as many as 13 in the second half. But Elon would not go away and was able to close to within 4 points twice in the final minute, but could not draw any closer. Chris Chalko missed a 3-pointer that would have narrowed the margin to 60-59 with 38 seconds remaining. Davidson hit foul shots in the waning seconds for the final 7-point margin. Elon (15-14) was the tournament's No. 2 seed but Davidson has not lost to Elon since the Phoenix joined the league in 2003-04. And Davidson has eliminated Elon each year in the conference tournament. Johnson went 8-of-10 from 2-point range and was 5-6 from behind the arc. Brendan Winters added 14 points for the Wildcats while Jason Morton contributed 14. Jackson Atoyebi led Elon with 14 while Chalko added 12. Davidson shot just over 41 percent from the field although Elon shot almost 45 percent. But Davidson was 44 percent from 3-point range while Elon was only 20 percent from behind the arc.
